args:
Yukimura persuades Izumo to face his fears and
find the will to fight, causing Oki to vanish. As
Shingen clings to life and Izumo leads the party
to an audience with Amaterasu, the final battle
with Tsukuyomi awaits in Takamagahara.
No! No, no, NO! That's not possible!\nLady Tsukuyomi's soldiers of the\nunderworld CAN'T fall!
But fine! Whatever! My master can make\nas many new soldiers as she needs to.
Right now, I am very, very, VERY mad.
And what of it? You're going to kill me?\nIzumo also dies if you do that, you know.
And that's a shame, but I'll do whatever\nhas to be done. First, though...
I want to talk. Both to you, and to the\nIzumo who's sleeping inside you.
Talk? To what end? Do you think I'll reveal\nwhere Lady Tsukuyomi is hiding?
No, no tricks or anything. It's just that...\nWell, I know what it feels like when you're\njerked around by forces you can't control.
I used to live my life locked up in a castle.\nNo one to talk to. No friends. Just listening\nto what others told me, day after day.
But then I met this light—the general.\nHe gave me the strength and the\nheart to fight.
He raised me. Made me what I am today.\nAnd now, I can see...
I could have fought more back then.\nI could have struggled with all that I was.
If it hurts? If it's hard? If you're lonely?\nYou can absolutely struggle against that.\nIt's okay to fight back.
That goes for you too.\nYou can struggle and fight your way back\ninto the light, Izumo.
The Eight-span Mirror is glowing! But...
No! How can Izumo be reawakening?!
But why, Izumo?! You're the one who said\nyou were hurting! You HATED being an\nemissary, remember?!
Yes, there were times it hurt. But I never\nwished for Tsukuyomi's return, and I don't\nwant that now.
So instead you'll live your whole life in\nthat little cage of a court and let them\nkeep using you? Don't be an idiot!
No one was using me. These are choices\nI made for myself.
We were never ALLOWED to make choices!\nNever given a means to fight back!
Ah, but we did. We had the wisdom I was\ngiven by Lady Amaterasu.

I could have spoken with the court and
created opportunities to reshape the rules.
I just never tried. Instead, I was content to
simply accept my lot in life.
I was weak, Oki. I was afraid to fight—\nboth with others and myself.
That goes for you too.\nYou can struggle and fight your way back\ninto the light, Izumo.
...She's right. I can't stay like this.\nIf I don't break free of my shell,\nI'll always be weak.
And I'm sick of that. I WANT to fight.\nI want to fight my enemies, and my\ncircumstances, and myself!
But we're friends, Izumo!\nWould you really betray that?
You were the one who chose betrayal.
Just saying these things to you has made\nmy heart feel lighter. Thanks for listening\nto me, like you always have.

But it's precisely because we shared so
much that I have to do this. It'll be lonely,
but I have to learn to be strong so I can
help Lady Amaterasu.
...I never wanted you to do anything\nto hurt her.
Oh, so NOW you're gonna play the little\ngoody two-shoes?! Fine, then! It's over!\nWe're not friends anym—
I'm sorry. It was my own weakness that\ncreated you, but I promise I'll atone for all\nof your mistakes.
So I'm going to fight Tsukuyomi.
Oh, Yukimura... How can I ever apologize?
It's okay...\nIt's enough that you're back to yourself.
Everyone except for Shingen.\nHe still hasn't woken up.
Don't make that face. Lives are lost in\nwar—and besides, the general's soul\nnow lives on inside me.
Ooof... Now THAT hurts like the dickens.
Upsie daisy! ...Phew! I've come close to\ndeath before, but that was a real doozy.
Why the surprise? You missed my vital\norgans on purpose, right?
ACTUALLY, I DEFINITELY TRIED TO HIT\nMOST OF THEM!
Yeesh. No mercy, eh?\nWell then, I'm as much at a loss as the\nrest of you as to why I'm alive.
It appears the powerful chi from\nYukimura's attack has dispersed the\nYomi chi within you.
And the lethal blow was likely prevented...\nby these.
What's that, some kind of talisma—GAH!\nLook in your armor! There's gotta be\nhundreds of 'em crammed in there!
Protective wards, imbued with my power.\nI have been placing one in your armor\non each passing night, Lord Shingen.
I never realized they held such meaning,\nthough I'd been curious about them since\nI was a small lad.
And I am glad that my efforts since your\ninfancy have finally born fruit.
It's the power of you two's love, FuMyo!\nI am SUPER moved right now!
Pray do not speak of it aloud, for this is\na love I keep hidden in my breast.
AAAAANYWAY, Shingen is safe, and that's\nwhat matters. All's well that ends well!
Actually, that's not quite the end. Yes,\nShingen is back and the mole is gone,\nbut we need to decide our next move.
And we still don't have any idea how to\nbeat Tsukuyomi.
Actually, there might be a way.

Perhaps. Since becoming aware of Oki's
existence, I have his memories in my
head—which means I also share his
knowledge of Tsukuyomi.
According to that, Tsukuyomi is using Yomi\nchi to revive herself after each defeat.
So if we fight in a place where she can't\naccess that chi, she might be vulnerable.
YOU ARE SUCH A CRAZY SMARTYPANTS!\nUh, but where would we go for a place\nlike that? Alberia's kinda far from here...
I know of only one option...
The realm created by Lady Amaterasu.
...Wait, so THIS is Takamagahara?\nIt looks like every other Hinomotoan town!
Just what manner of place is this, Izumo?
To speak of this realm is to reveal\nthe truth of Amaterasu.
As you know, Lady Amaterasu is the great\nbeing who guides Hinomoto.
However, she no longer possesses\na material form.
If one considers the loss of the flesh to be\ndeath, then yes. She is dead.
Have you heard the legend of the soulpact\nformed between Lady Amaterasu and the\noriginal shogun?
Ieyasu told us about it. The shogun begged\nAmaterasu's aid in order to end a long war\nthat had ravaged the land.

In turn, the shogun's line and the twelve
branch houses all gained the ability to
shapeshift at the cost of a significantly
decreased lifespan.
Just so. But that legend tells only the\nhuman side of the story.
Lady Amaterasu—the dragon who\nengineered the soulpact—also paid\na most heavy price.
Giving up her body, I take it. But hold on!\nWhy would a dragon have to pay a heavier\nprice than the humans?
At the War of Earth and Heaven's end,\ndragons swore to never again intervene in\nthis land. Lady Amaterasu broke that rule.
Knowing the cost, she still willingly\nshared her strength with humans.
So both man and dragon wished for peace\nin our nation, even at the cost of their own\nlives...
And you say that legend has some tie\nto this realm?
This land was crafted from the chi\nI left behind.
Whoa! Where's that voice coming from?!
Ha ha ha! I have no body, child,\nas Izumo so recently explained.
Okay, everybody back up a step or two or\nfifty. Didn't he JUST say you were dead?
I said that if the loss of one's body were\nconsidered death, then she was dead.
But though flesh may give way, the soul\nremains. And in that form did I gather my\nchi and take the form of a humble garden.
Should Hinomoto fall into crisis once\nmore, I thought this might allow me to\nat least shelter her people within myself.
You turned yourself into a WORLD?\nJust how powerful a dragon were you?
I am but a faint echo of the power of the\nancestral dragons Izanagi and Izanami,\nthey who birthed the land of Hinomoto.
But enough of me. I have heard what has\ntranspired. You will fight then, Izumo?
I must, My Lady—and moreover, I want to.\nI want to fight against both the sins of my\nother self and Tsukuyomi.
Yet I know you hate conflict, Lady\nAmaterasu, so do you object?
And would you be angry if I asked you to\nlend us this place as a battlefield?
Ha ha! What reason would I have to object\nwhen this is the decision you reached?

I am joyed to hear it, Izumo. You have
stifled your own heart in my service
overlong, and it pleases me greatly to
see you finally assert yourself.
By the War of Earth and Heaven's end,\nHinomoto had become a barren and\nlifeless place.
It was not the hand of dragons that sowed\nnew life here, but you humans.
Over a great many years, using your short\nlives, each generation in turn fought\nagainst great hardship and overcame it.
I am thankful to your kind for mending that\nwhich dragons put to ruin. In fact, I hold\nyou all in great affection.
Why then should I offer anything less\nthan the fullness of my support?
Goodness, but this one is lively indeed!\nI pray for your victory, children of man.
Your emissary Izumo will see this battle\nwon and the peace of your beloved\nHinomoto preserved!
